>>134333342
listen one scene Aang is continent destroying demigod, the other he literally trips over his own feet while fighting two faceless nameless mooks, then gets knocked unconscious

characters do what writers want them to be in a particular scene without much connection to the rest of the story

also only Katara, Suki and Toph are more or less in character, while especially Zuko, Azula Mai and even Aang act like completely different people to whom they are in the show

and that's important because characters were the thing carrying AtLA to its popularity, without them the any new show or comics will just flop

A good example is Zuko's character, especially in contrast with Aang's.
Despite being introduced as a generic misunderstood goodguy forced to do bad, that we were all expecting to join team Avatar by the end of se1 - he sort of subverts our expectations.
It turns out that as his strength and competence rises, the pull of the dark side doesn't lessen on him. In fact, due to his increased power level, the chance for him embracing the darkness becomes more probable.

Or in other words, when Zuko makes a choice it is impactful, precisely because he has both the drive and power required to select either of the possible options and face the consequences, without just being swept away.
And when he makes wrong decisions, it, because of the power he wields, create bad consequences that Zuko has to fix.

This sort of 'honorable barbarian warrior just trying his best' persona that Zuko has is what makes it fun to watch him do stuff. It also creates a context for his internal moral struggles thanks to which it doesnt come off like whining, as opposed to Kataras 'but my mom' shit.

So what they do with Zuko in the comics?

They introduce a major plot point, that Zuko is apparently one bad day away from turning into Ozai. But then go out of their way to show that Zuko has neither the power, nor drive to do so.

So the whole thing falls flat on its face.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>134332373
>How do we feel about the twins? Honestly I feel like they're a consolation prize.

Same here. And not a particularly good one.

Phillip Kennedy Johnson (and the entire DC editorial staff) seems to have no understanding of what made Jon Kent work before the age-up, or why the Warworld twins aren't going to magically cover that base ("Look guys! Kids! -- You're happy now, right?!"). I think most Superman readers really enjoyed the idea of Clark raising his own young son, who had begun to lead his own double secret identity life of Superboy, while gradually teaching him about how to be superhero -- along with all of the growing pains involved as Jon would slowly become a young teen.

Of course, there's also the whole "Odd Couple" dynamic with Damian Wayne and Super Sons that you'll also never be able to recreate with the twins either. Superboy and Robin just functioned perfectly together as diametric opposites (innocent farm-boy and former assassin, city mouse and country mouse, etc) who somehow bonded and formed a tight friendship and learned from one another. The constant bickering peppered with moments of genuine support was incredibly fun.

This could have lasted for a decade, or even been the status quo for generations, with all of the merchandising money and cartoons that would come along with it. But DC messed it up. So now they're trying to recreate it in the most inauthentic and inorganic way possible.

threads.com:
Stargaze is a /co/ collaborative space where anons pitch concepts, write episodes, and draw production art for the greatest toy commercial animated series that never was (but everyone still remembers) : Stargaze and the Sentinels of Starlight!

>The story thus far
Star-ro, Prince of the cracked planet Astray, wields the Royal Blaster (a relic of immeasurable power containing the last shard of the Lightstar) against the forces of evil as the Hero Stargaze!

Alongside him in this noble fight against the fearsome creature of the void Nebillious and all agents of evil in the galaxy are a wide cast of friends and comrades, the Sentinels of Starlight.
Chief among them
>Conshock
the cloven hoofed psychic pugilist
>Usra-La
The beautiful yet hot tempered Bar-Barean shaman warrior
>Rock-it
the fearsome yet kind hearted veteran of the Geosphere
>Lanstar
The cocksure and tech savvy friend of Star-ro
>Comet
The half Baastanian half sister of Star-ro, always causing mischief

Along with the cerebral Trancia, illustrious Pum-mel, fearsome Krogdar, shifty Shang-Xu, packrat scrapper Tonns, warrior of the shadows Jet-Hawk, honorable Hammer Hex, the incredible Robo-Puppy, and many more!

Fighting the villainous legions of the Astrayan traitor Warmaster, the voracious Hogmaw, the rogue robotic AI Wireshark, the seductive insect queen Cicadre and her manipulative assassin Scorpionic, the metal-eating Jaw-breaker, the mysterious and vicious technomancer Sigil, and the master of evil himself: The Nefarious Nebullious!
Creature of terror, the void made form with the dastardly ability to SUMMON SEVERAL HUNDRED SMOKE SNAKES! Enemy of all who wish for peace in the lightstar galaxy. He seeks the Royal Blaster and should he get it cosmos will never be the same!

threads.com:
>What is this thread?
Every Wins'day at Win-O'-Clock we gather here and post links to the latest scans and rips of comic books.
Most links we uploaded ourselves, others we are sharing from elsewhere.
Some comics we've even purchased ourselves (but most we didn't).
If you'd like to help out, just ask and we would be delighted to tell you how.
Otherwise, be patient, be polite, and understand the simple concept behind these words: Not posted means not available yet.

>Where can I find old Win-O'-Threads?
http://desuarchive.org/co/search/subject/Official%20Win-O'-Thread/
http://boards.fireden.net/co/search/subject/Official%20Win-O'-Thread/
(Note: This finds the OP for old threads. If you want to search for comics in the archive, clear the subject field!)

>Where can I find downloads for other comics?
Warez forums/blogs, DDL-indexing search engines (like FilesLoop), torrent trackers (like 1337x) and other P2P networks (like DC++).
If a link has been posted on 4chan, you can search for it in the Desu archive (add "http*" to searches to return only posts with links).
If all else fails, just >buy it.

>Where can I buy comics?
http://www.amazon.com/
On the various publishers' webstores, and at your local comics shop.

>Where can I find an LCS?
http://www.comicshoplocator.com/

>Where can I find out when new comics are released?
http://www.comiclist.com/index.php
http://www.previewsworld.com

>How do I download from websites that only give me .exe files?
Untick the checkbox under the download button.

>How can I find this thread every week?
If you are using the inline extension go to http://4chan.org/co/official or use the option under "Filters & Post Hiding".
If you have 4chanX go to Settings > Filter > Subject and add the following line:
/Official Win-O'-Thread/;highlight

>And last but not least
I hope I finish posting this before the previous thread dies
